content: Who was the lead singer of the rock band Queen, famous for hits like "Bohemian Rhapsody" and "Don't Stop Me Now"?

The lead singer of the rock band Queen was Freddie Mercury. He was born Farrokh Bulsara on September 5, 1946, in Stone Town, Zanzibar, and he passed away on November 24, 1991. Freddie Mercury was not only the lead vocalist but also the primary songwriter and leader of the band. His powerful voice, flamboyant stage presence, and songwriting skills played a significant role in making Queen one of the most successful and influential rock bands in history.
